title: Helen Hunt shares first photo after car crash that flipped her car on its side
text:
CLOSE Helen Hunt has been released from the hospital following a traffic accident in which her car flipped on its side, according to multiple reports. USA TODAY

Helen Hunt is back on social media after surviving a car crash that resulted in her car getting flipped onto its side.

People and TMZ reported that the actress, 56, was transported to a nearby hospital after the accident last Wednesday in Los Angeles. Hunt's representative Stephen Huvane told USA TODAY a day later that Hunt was recovering at home with "no major injuries."

Hunt took to Instagram late Thursday to share a photo of herself – her first post since the crash – with "Mad About You" co-star Paul Reiser.

"Back at work," she captioned the photo with a praying hands emoji.

Hunt's followers took to the comment section to welcome her back.

Fellow actress Tracie Thoms wrote "Thank GOD!!!" with a heart-eye emoji.

Actress Mindy Cohn wrote, "best news" with a kiss emoji.

And actress Merrin Dungey said Hunt looked "Gorgeous."

"Can’t wait to watch!" she added.

LAPD Officer Drake Madison confirmed to USA TODAY on Oct. 17 that an accident involving two vehicles took place at 4:50 p.m. on San Vincente Boulevard in Los Angeles but declined to name the parties involved. One person was taken to the hospital, he added.

Footage obtained by TMZ showed a white car striking a black SUV in the middle of an intersection. The SUV continued to skid through the intersection before rolling onto the driver's side.

Hunt is best known for her Academy Award-winning performance in 1997's "As Good as It Gets," as well as her four-time Emmy-winning role as Jamie Buchman in "Mad About You."
